page.title: 09TRANSPORT CONTINUED
page.content: Going south to Buxton there were 43 cars,9 vans,20 lorries,1 bus,0 two wheelers and 11 pedestrians. Coming South from Buxton there were 61 cars,19 vans,20 lorries,0 buses,4 two wheelers and 11 pedestrians. Going West to Macclesfield there were 73 cars,14 vans,6 lorries,0 buses,1 two wheeler and 32 pedestrians. Coming West from Macclesfield there were 61 cars,17 vans,10 lorries,0 buses,0 two wheelers and 36 pedestrians. A new bypass is being built at the moment so that the A6 will not go through Whaley Bridge or Chapel en le Frith.The people living in these towns are very pleased that the amount of traffic will be reduced but people living near the bypass are very upset. RICHARD AIZLEWOOD.
